website_summaries.verdict: A top contender for an all-in-one washer and dryer that works well and has plenty of options.
pros: Consumers praise the flexibility and convenience of this model, reporting that it cleans well and is versatile enough for many different items
We love the space-saving design, and it also has the bonus of eliminating static during the drying cycle
Comes with a convenient storage drawer
cons: Tends to take longer to dry than standard models
Some consumers reported having difficulty with pet hair accumulating in the unit

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Pump has been replaced 4 times.

customer_reviews.title: Either elevate the washer or lower where the drain tubs goes
customer_reviews.text: Dont listen to people claiming it takes 3 hours to dry small loads. The issue is this washer does not have a powerful drain pump ( and you may need to replace the drain pump ~$30 every couple years when it fails because it will). So you will need to make sure the washing machines drain tube is as LOW as possible. It will not be able to push water out to a drain higher two feet which most drains are over that high. So you can do what I did and buy a grey water pump to push water to where it needs to go.

customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love the space is saves. Love the ease of throwing in dirty clothes and 2 hours later I have clean and dry clothes. Love the water and electricity it saves! I have not had any issues. When I did a larger load it took over 2 hours, but not too long. At first, I thought the clothes kind of felt damp when I got them out, but I realized that was just the steam, and they really were dry. I think it cleans much better than my old top loader. Very happy with this purchase!

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice combination, but mine broke down in about 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice combination, but mine broke down in about 5 months under heavy use. The main problem lies in that this is washer and dryer combo. The dryer part of it produces *a lot* of lint, which surprisingly is not caught with a conventional filter. In my case, the lint accumulates so much that eventually it got to clone the drain and causing the drain motor to fail. If you take a close look at the drain filter, it is not really designed to catch any of it. I now have a conventional back up washer/dryer in case it fails again.
